text: Jacques Le Goff (1 January 1924 â€“ 1 April 2014) was a French historian and author. He wrote many books about the Middle Ages. Mostly during the 12th and 13th centuries. Le Goff was known for arguing that the Middle Ages created a new civilization. In 1984, he wrote The Birth of Purgatory. He was elected a member of the Academia Europaea in 1989. Le Goff was born in Toulon.
